content: Gujaratis are settlers in Mumbai! Importantly, the medieval Gujarat i Sultanate in 1300 was an Islamic rule. Post Gujarat was later ruled by the Marathas until 1818 ended by British rule from 1818 onwards. Mumbai including Gujrat was part of Maratha Kingdom, the last rule before the start of foreign power British Empire. Technically Marathis can claim all the territory they captured since foreign power British had now left. #Mumbai #Maharashtra #‡§Æ‡•Å‡§Ç‡§¨‡§à‡§Æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§†�‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡§∏‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä‡§ö‡§Ç Adivaraha @vajrayudha11¬∑Jul 5 Maharashtra and Mumbai aren‚Äôt the same. Marathi isn‚Äôt the only local language of Mumbai. Since its foundation it has sizable Gujarati and Parsi (speaks Gujarati) population. It was capital of Gujarat as well. Gujaratis aren‚Äôt migrants but native of the city. Telling them to speak x.com/agentsaffron/s‚Ä¶

3 Notifications Historic Honour for Maharashtra! Delighted to share that 12 iconic forts of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj have Messages been inscribed in the UNESCO World Heritage List, a monumental recognition of Maratha legacy and India‚Äôs cultural pride. Earlier this year, in February, I had the honour of leading a delegation to Grok UNESCO headquarters in Paris, where we made a comprehensive technical presentation supporting Maharashtra‚Äôs nomination. The recognised forts are Raigad, Rajgad, Pratapgad, Panhala, Shivneri, Lohgad, Salher, Lists Sindhudurg, Vijaydurg, Suvarnadurg, Khanderi in Maharashtra and Gingee/Jinji in Tamil Nadu. Grateful to Hon‚Äôble Prime Minister Narendra Modi Ji for his vision and Bookmarks unwavering support. This achievement was made possible by the active backing of the Central Government, the Ministry of Culture, and the Archaeological Survey of India. Jobs Also, special applause to Hon‚Äôble Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, and Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar -led Mahayuti government for their consistent backing that made this Communities proud moment possible. This is not just Maharashtra‚Äôs pride ‚Äî it's Bharat‚Äôs pride. Jai Bhavani, Jai Shivaji! India's 44th World Heritage Site - Maratha Military Landscapes of India - the serial nominated sites demonstrating the extraordinary fortification and military system envisioned by the Maratha rulers through a nuanced understanding of nature - the landscape, terrain, and physiographic characteristics of the landscape from islands, the Konkan coast, the Sahyadri hills and forests and over across the Deccan Plateau to the Eastern Ghats in the Indian peninsula. @moefcc @wii_india @SACONCoimbatore @GobindsagarBha1 @sureshwii @nehrutp @UNESCO @ASIGoI @IUCN @ICOMOS @ICCROM @vishalvsharma7 @builthistories #natureculturelinkages #worldheritage #47whc #wiic2c #marathaforts Prathamesh Anand 1 10 310 @Prathamesh56451 ArjunKumar@Hiddenheritage¬∑Jul12 Arjun Kumar@Hiddenheritage¬∑Jul 12 Delighted that 12 forts within 'Maratha Military Landscape' recd UNESCO World Heritage status. Long overdue recognition to the role of #Marathas in rebuilding #Bharat. Esp love that Gingee made the cut, underlining the Home larger impact of the Marathas. Jobs Replying to @KailashGWagh Historic Triumph for India! Communities We the people of Bharat ie. India very proudly celebrate the inclusion of 12 iconic forts of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in the UNESCO World Premium Heritage List as sites of "Outstanding Universal Value." These Maratha Military Landscapes, developed between the 17th and 19th Verified Orgs centuries, showcase the visionary fortification and military system of our great King. Profile The 12 forts include: Maharashtra: Raigad, Rajgad, Pratapgad, Panhala, Shivneri, Lohagad, More Salher, Sindhudurg, Vijaydurg, Suvarnadurg, Khanderi Tamil Nadu: Jinji Post Built for Swarajya, these forts brilliantly integrate the diverse landscapes of the Sahyadri ranges, Konkan Coast, Deccan Plateau, and Eastern Ghats, reflecting extraordinary strategic and architectural brilliance. Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj successfully lead his Hindu Maratha brave warriors army against desert faith foreign Islamists invaders in Mughals , Nizams, AdilShahi, Britishers, Portuguese and Dutch enemies. Heartfelt gratitude to Hon. Prime Minister Narendra Modi ji for his unwavering support, the Central Government, Archaeological Survey of India, and the Ministry of Culture for their invaluable contributions. Special thanks to Maharashtra government then lead by DCM Eknath Shinde and Minister‚Äôs for their impactful presentation to UNESCO‚Äôs Director General, to ACS Vikas Kharge, India‚Äôs Ambassador to UNESCO Vishal Sharma, and Hemant Dalvi from the Directorate of Archaeology and Museums. #UNESCO This milestone is a testament to our collective pride in preserving the legacy of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj! #UNESCO #MarathaHeritage #ChhatrapatiShivajiMaharaj #ShivajiMaharaj #ProudMoment The media could not be played. SangamMahuliisagroupof18thand19thcenturyHindutemplesbuiltina Sangam Mahuli is a group of 18th and 19th century Hindu temples built in a typical Maratha style. Sri Kashi Vishweshwar Temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. The temple was built in 1735 CE by Shripatrao Pant Pratinidhi in Satara, Maharashtra. Home Explore 3 Notifications Messages Grok Lists
